text.div:
ODH InformationEntry Logical Model

An entry in a patient record or in a report, generally used for the documentation of clinical information about a subject of information such as a patient or a relative of the patient, asserted by a particular source, recorded, and potentially verified.

name: InformationEntryModel
title: ODH InformationEntry Logical Model
description: An entry in a patient record or in a report, generally used for the documentation of clinical information about a subject of information such as a patient or a relative of the patient, asserted by a particular source, recorded, and potentially verified.

element.definition: An entry in a patient record or in a report, generally used for the documentation of clinical information about a subject of information such as a patient or a relative of the patient, asserted by a particular source, recorded, and potentially verified.

element.short: The person this entry belongs to.
element.definition: The person this entry belongs to.

element.short: The subject of the observation, if someone other than the person of record (the patient) is the subject, for example, a relative of the person of record.
element.definition: The subject of the observation, if someone other than the person of record (the patient) is the subject, for example, a relative of the person of record.

element.short: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.
element.definition: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.

element.short: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.
element.definition: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

element.short: Provenance information specific to the signing of the clinical statement.
element.definition: Provenance information specific to the signing of the clinical statement.
